page.title: 01East of East Dereham
page.content: Farmland, of an arable nature and mainly given over to cereals (barley) and root crops (sugar beet), dominates. Some land also produces seasonal cash crops of soft fruits (strawberries,raspberries,gooseberries ,blackcurrants,etc)and the untilled land supports small numbers of beef cattle. The other main feature of the area is the A47 trunk road. It runs roughly east-west but plunges southwards in order to by-pass East Dereham. The road joins Norwich (16 miles eastwards) with King's Lyndd (25 miles to the west) though in summer it becomes a major holiday route for tourists travelling via Norwich to Great Yarmouth and the Norfolk Broads. Nearly all signs of settlement are along this road.
